summary: This bill, H.R. 4165, amends the Public Health Service Act to enhance the National Health Security Strategy. It mandates the inclusion of a biological attribution strategy focused on improving Federal coordination in identifying the source of biological hazards and pathogens, including diagnostic and sequencing capabilities. The bill also requires the development and implementation of an early warning strategy and implementation plan for biological, chemical, and radiological threats, emphasizing early detection, technology adaptation, and coordination with various public and private entities.
